description: Applications for Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) checks, which are needed for certain jobs like those involving working with children or vulnerable adults.
title: Enhanced criminal records checks
description-extra: DBS checks have replaced Criminal Records Bureau (CRB) checks. The DBS checks against spent and unspent convictions, cautions, reprimands and final warnings. It also checks against approved local police records and the DBS barred lists.
costs: Cost of processing a paid DBS check application is based on 21% of the application figure shown above being free of charge. Used for cost recovery purposes. (As stated in annual accounts note 22). DBS is not yet able to separate cost of paper and digital application.
other-notes:
DBS was formed from the former Criminal Records Bureau (CRB) and the Independent Safeguarding Authority (ISA) in December 2012.
The start point of all data periods shown for this service is December 2012.

modules.title: Total cost
info: Cost of processing a paid DBS check application is based on 21% of the application figure shown above being free of charge. Used for cost recovery purposes. (As stated in annual accounts note 22). DBS is not yet able to separate cost of paper and digital application.

Total cost is the overall cost per year of providing a service, including staff, IT and accommodation costs; the total cost is automatically calculated from volume and cost per transaction figures, and some rounding errors may occur.

modules.title: Cost per transaction
info: Cost of processing a paid DBS check application is based on 21% of the application figure shown above being free of charge. Used for cost recovery purposes. (As stated in annual accounts note 22). DBS is not yet able to separate cost of paper and digital application.
Cost per transaction is the average cost of providing each successfully completed transaction, across all channels. Staff, IT and accommodation costs should be included.

modules.title: Transactions per quarter
modules.description: Total number of transactions each quarter

modules.title: Digital take-up
info: Digital take-up measures the percentage of completed applications that are made through a digital channel versus non-digital channels.
